title: Build dependencies are not listed as installed packages in environments
body:
When working with an activate environment only run/link dependencies are shown when listing installed packages.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Though I originally noticed this issue when installing `llvm` it can be much easier to reproduce with several small packages.  Using a newly created environment:

```console
$ spack env status
==> Using spack.yaml in current directory: /var/tmp/spack-paul/var/spack/environments/test-find
$ spack install bzip2
...
$ spack find
==> In environment test-find
==> Root specs
bzip2

==> 1 installed package
-- linux-centos7-haswell / gcc@9.1.0 ----------------------------
bzip2@1.0.8
$ spack install libxml2
...
$ spack find
==> In environment test-find
==> Root specs
bzip2   libxml2

==> 5 installed packages
-- linux-centos7-haswell / gcc@9.1.0 ----------------------------
bzip2@1.0.8  libiconv@1.16  libxml2@2.9.9  xz@5.2.4  zlib@1.2.11
```

In the case of `bzip2` there is only a single build dependency, `diffutils`. And with `libxml2` the only build (only) dependency is `pkgconfig` which does no appear. It should be noted that in both cases all dependencies where accounted for in the spec and installed.

### Information on your system

When testing I did a `git clone` and use the most recent commit (e7add79cba27b161eb54b86d6212623c9069ef70).

[spack.lock.zip](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/4064014/spack.lock.zip)
